channel.title: Geospatial on Matt Richards - Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Geospatial on Matt Richards - Blog

item.title: Tips for success installing python packages
item.description: Although python has a functional story around packaging, there are plenty of footguns for people who only occasionally dabble with package management. This situation is fairly common in my line of work, when a project is started, the project team get set up with working developer environments, and then happily forget about packaging problems for the next x months until the next project starts. So this is a quick reference I hope to point people to the next time I get “my python environment isn’t working / I can’t install package x questions”.

item.title: Setting up a pandas/main environment for GeoPandas
item.description: Although it’s not something I tend to advertise very often, I’m a maintainer for GeoPandas which is the de-facto standard tool for tabular geospatial analysis in Python. My contributions here wax and wane here with the amount of free time and mental space I have to volunteer. As part of this, we keep the software in sync with developments in pandas, and our CI tests against pandas/main. From time to time (more frequently with the upcoming pandas 2.
